original: BERGENGREN, Erik, Direktör, fd Konsul, Författare, Hälsingborg, f Hbg 11/3 00 av civ.ing Harald B o Siri Aspelin, gm ex. väv-lär. Anna Margit Cecilia Olsson. Hbgs h a lärov 09—16, Hbgs hdlsgymn 16—18, Schirpkes Hdlssch. i Dresden 22—23, språk-, arkit- o hdlsstud i Oxford 23—24, Stats kav.sk, Ränneslätt 20—21. Anst v Höganäs-Billesholm AB 19—22, Warholme, Smith & Co, London, 25—26, styr.led i AB Byggn.materialier, Hbg, 22, anställd i d :o 26, v. dir sed. 36. Led av lok. värd.nmdn f krigsm :s behov sed. 36, av länsstyr.kom. f ink. t krigsm :s behov, litauisk konsul 36—40, Ist.serg sed. 40, styr.led 1 Sv Röda K. Hbgskr. II 31—34, v. ordf i Hbgs mani. Röda K.kår sed. 34, stift o ständ medl av Finl. Röda K., ständ medl av jap., Ital., polska o portug. Röda K., Sv Röda K:s repr v int konf i Tokio 34, i Köpenhamn 34, stift o styr.led. i Förutv. Hdlsgymn. Förb., Hbg, 19—21, d:o i Mercurigillet 21—23, stift o sekr i Gillet Gamla Hbg sed. 34, v. sekr i Hbgs Rotary 36—38, stift o v. ordf i Fören 1900 års män i Sthlm sed. 39, d :o i Skånefören 1900 års män 39, styr.led i Corps Consul. Skåneavd sed. 42, medl av Nät. Geographic Soc. of Washington sed. 26, av Travell. Club 43 BERGENGREN i Malmö sed. 36, i Sthlm sed. 42. Resor: Tyskl 21, 22, 23, 25, 26, 28, 29, 31, 33, 34, 37, 38, Engl 24, 28, 29, Frankr 24, 25, 26, 29, 31, Belg 26, Schweiz 29, 31, 37, 38, Holl 25, 26, 28, Portug, Span, Balearerna, Pitiuserna, Algeriet, Marocko 29, Corfu, Montenegro 31, Ital 29, 31, 38, Österr 31. 37, 38, Syrien, Palestina, Egypt 31, Jugoslav 31, 38, Polen, Ryssl 34, Vitryssl, Sibirien, Mandsjuriet, Mandsjukuo, Kina, Japan, Hawaii, Kaliforn 34, Guatem, Salvador, Mexiko, Panama, Sydamer, Columbia, Västind, USA, Canada 35, fullst världsomsegl österut 34—35, Ung o Tjeckoslv 38, besteg Grossglock-ner 37. Av trycket: Prolog 20, Begreppsförklaringar 21, Nippon (övers, t 14 språk) 26, Benjamins Cocktailsbok 31, Snok i lasten 34, Pilgrimsfärd t krigargravar 36, Gula glimtar 36, Gelbe Gesichter 37, Sjutton år 38, Den illustr, kofferten 38, Tio år på trettio minuter, Historik över Hbgs Rödakorskår 29—39, 40, Bruden brinner 42 (t tyska 43). Off LitGedO, SRKSM, TRKHt, JapRKFtjM, JapRKHt, FrRKHt, SpRKGM, SpRKHt, SpRKJubM, SpRKDunM, BulgRKHt l o 2, PolRKHt, PortRKHt, PortRKJubM, TKrMM, UngKrMM, BulgKrMM, KavSM, SjvM simmag. br. Hobbies: Släktforskn, rödakorsverksamhet, rep-tilstud.
translated: BERGENGREN, Erik, Director, former Consul, Author, Helsingborg, b Hbg 11/3 00, son of civil engineer Harald B and Siri Aspelin, married to former weaving instructor Anna Margit Cecilia Olsson. Attended Hbgs secondary school 09-16, Hbgs commercial high school 16-18, Schirpkes Commercial School in Dresden 22-23, language, architecture, and commerce studies in Oxford 23-24, Royal Cavalry School, Ränneslätt 20-21. Employed at Höganäs-Billesholm AB 19-22, Warholme, Smith & Co, London, 25-26, board member of AB Building Materials, Hbg, 22, employee of the company 26, deputy director since 36. Member of the local supply committee for the military's needs since 36, member of the county government committee for income taxes for the military's needs, Lithuanian consul 36-40, reserve sergeant since 40, board member of the Swedish Red Cross Hbgskr. II 31-34, vice chairman of Hbg's Red Cross Corps since 34, permanent and standing member of the Finnish Red Cross, standing member of the Japanese, Italian, Polish, and Portuguese Red Cross, representative of the Swedish Red Cross at international conferences in Tokyo 34, in Copenhagen 34, founding and board member of the Association for Advanced Commercial High School, Hbg, 19-21, same in Mercurigillet 21-23, founding and secretary of the Association Gamla Hbg since 34, vice secretary of Hbg's Rotary Club 36-38, founding and vice chairman of the Association of Men of the Year 1900 in Stockholm since 39, same in Skåne's Association of Men of the Year 39, board member of the Consul Corps Skåne division since 42, member of the National Geographic Society of Washington since 26, member of the Travellers' Club 43 in Malmö since 36, in Stockholm since 42. Travels: Germany 21, 22, 23, 25, 26, 28, 29, 31, 33, 34, 37, 38, England 24, 28, 29, France 24, 25, 26, 29, 31, Belgium 26, Switzerland 29, 31, 37, 38, Netherlands 25, 26, 28, Portugal, Spain, Balearic Islands, Pitiusas Islands, Algeria, Morocco 29, Corfu, Montenegro 31, Italy 29, 31, 38, Austria 31, 37, 38, Syria, Palestine, Egypt 31, Yugoslavia 31, 38, Poland, Russia 34, Belarus, Siberia, Manchuria, Manchukuo, China, Japan, Hawaii, California 34, Guatemala, El Salvador, Mexico, Panama, South America, Colombia, West Indies, USA, Canada 35, circumnavigated the world eastward 34-35, Hungary and Czechoslovakia 38, climbed Grossglockner 37. Published works: Prologue 20, Definitions 21, Nippon (translated into 14 languages) 26, Benjamin's Cocktail Book 31, Snake in the Cargo 34, Pilgrimage to Warrior Graves 36, Yellow Glints 36, Yellow Faces 37, Seventeen Years 38, The Illustrated Suitcase 38, Ten Years in Thirty Minutes, History of Hbg's Red Cross Corps 29-39, 40, The Bride is Burning 42 (also in German 43). Officer of the Swedish Order of Vasa (LO), Swedish Red Cross Decoration for George Medal (SRKSM), Transylvania Cross for Homeland Remembrance (TRKHt), Japanese Red Crescent Gold Medal (JapRKFtjM), Japanese Red Cross Decoration (JapRKHt), French Red Cross Decoration for Grand Master (FrRKHt), Spanish Red Cross Grand Medal (SpRKGM), Spanish Red Cross Decoration (SpRKHt), Spanish Red Cross Jubilee Medal (SpRKJubM), Spanish Red Cross Distinguished Medal (SpRKDunM), Bulgarian Red Cross Decoration 1 and 2 (BulgRKHt), Polish Red Cross Decoration (PolRKHt), Portuguese Red Cross Decoration (PortRKHt), Portuguese Red Cross Jubilee Medal (PortRKJubM), Turkish Red Crescent Medal (TKrMM), Hungarian Red Cross Medal (UngKrMM), Bulgarian Red Cross Medal (BulgKrMM), Cavalry Sports Medal (KavSM), Navy Diver's Silver Medal (SjvM simmag. br.). Hobbies: Genealogy, Red Cross work, reptile studies.

structured.name: Erik Bergengren
awards: Swedish Red Cross Decoration for George Medal
French Red Cross Decoration for Grand Master
